block.p: Dr. Rita Evelyn Landman, a daughter of Josephine Landman and Dr. Silviu Landman of Vestal, N.Y., is to be married today to Michael Louis Gitlitz, the son of Sheila Gitlitz and Dr. George Gitlitz of Sarasota, Fla. Rabbi Lance J. Sussman is to perform the ceremony at Lyndhurst, a historic house in Tarrytown, N.Y.

Dr. Landman, 31, is keeping her name. She is a fellow in endocrinology at the Columbia-Presbyterian Center of New York Presbyterian Hospital. She graduated from Cornell and received a medical degree from New York University. Her father, a retired radiologist, practiced at Wilson Hospital in Johnson City, N.Y., and was an assistant professor of radiology at the Binghamton Clinical Campus of the Upstate Medical University of the State University of New York. Her mother is a sales agent in Vestal for Sbarra & Wells, a residential real estate company.

He graduated from Oberlin College and received a postgraduate diploma in the history of fine and decorative arts from the Sotheby's Institute in London. His mother, who is retired, was a speech pathologist and audiologist in Binghamton and Sarasota. His father, also retired, was a general and vascular surgeon in Binghamton.
